intro: Senecio crassifolius subsp. transiens, commonly known as the Transient Senecio, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems and large, fleshy, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine white powder. The plant produces yellow flowers in dense, terminal clusters, typically blooming in late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
